text:
Sampled in a glass poured from a bottle, 
this ale had a dark brown murky pour and gave a light tan colored lasting head of bubbles that had a yellow tint to them, there was nice spots and small fingers of lacing on the glass, 

the nose was malty and had aromas of caramel, a little dark fruit that resembled raisin and fig, some alcohol esters, faint earth notes, 
caramel candy and dark sugar sweetness, 

the flavors were malty, intense toasted malt with caramel and a little toffee, and toasted sweet bread, 
the finish had a light alcohol bitterness with malt and sweetness following, 

the mouth feel was pretty full and layered the tongue, it was a little creamy and had soft to average carbonation, faint warmth with each sip, 

the nose was very malty, lots of caramel and caramel like notes, toffee and faint dark fruit, 
the flavor was similar with a light alcohol bitterness and warmth on the mouth, 
this beer would be a good sipper on a cold evening.

URUS 3.0
Aroma: caramel, toffee, raisins, vanilla, molasses, toast, dried fruits
Taste: medium sweet, caramel, toast, raisins, dried fruits, vanilla

Pite na URUSie. W aromacie drewno, owoce wanilia jakby z beczki, której tu nie ma, nienachalna bejca. W smaku słodko, wanilia, owoce lekka bejca - fajne się utleniło. Pełne, wykleja usta, alk jeszcze trochę grzeje w przełyk. Złożone i świetne piwo.

0.75l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a cloudy looking darker reddish one. A nice big off-white head on the top, quickly fading but leaving lots of lacings on the sides of the glass. Smells really good. Fruity, dark berries, raisins, somewhat sugary. Not too sweet though. Mild needles. Å lovely aroma indeed. Tastes lovely also. Its thick syrupy and oily in the mouth, soft prickling on the carbonation. Vinous in the taste. Oak woody, sweet red sticky berries. A little sharp alcohol. So complex and balanced. A lovely tasting old ale. Would not mind a revisit on this one. 18.07.2015

Imbottigliata il 3 aprile 2014, aperta sabato 8 aprile 2017.
Rossa limpida con riflessi oro antico, schiuma ocra di media persistenza a grana media.
Aroma di nocciola, albicocca secca, uva passa e prugna, note di ribes nero, caramello, lievemente balsamica, note di bourbon e barrique.
Al palato attacca con caramello, fichi secchi, ribes nero e uva passa, poi in successione caramello, bourbon e barrique che permangono in un finale di discreta persistenza arricchito da lievi note di nocciola ed un forte e persistente amaro erbaceo.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata.

opalescent mahogany colour, minimal creamy yellowish-beige head; aroma of toffee, dried figs, walnut, citrusy and resiny notes; taste is the very same! it is a miracle - many thans, my friend, kapusil! its a perfect beer for celebration! :-)

0.75l bottle. Hazy dark amber body with a thin beige head. Aroma of caramel, toast, citrusy hops, nutmeg, raisins and dates. Taste of caramel, toast, orange zest, raisins and citrusy hops. Awesome. Even better that this is the 2500th rating of my friend Lore. Cheers!

Bottled in 2013. Just now opening this one up. Looking forward to it. 75CL, 3 finger tan head. Crap, realizing I should have saved this for AirForceHops who is coming in a few days. Im so sorry dude. A very murky dark red. looks hazy, lots of yeast in the bottom of the bottle. Cherry pit, peach, old fruit, molasses and leather aromas. Really good carbonation. thick, dense, really soft carbonation. really a perfect example of a bottle conditioned english ale. ripe apple, burnt sugar, tobacco, charcoal, baked apple, sweetness fades to an oak + fuggle flavor. good stuff.
@Basunen 17-2-4: lite sötaktig diskret doft men en stor och fyllig smak med toner av socker och russin. Mycket fin eftersmak med toner av lakrits och torkat frukt.

Bottle from 2013, as "Old Ale". Pours clear reddish chestnut, large creamy beige head, dissipates fairly quickly but with lots of residual and nice lacing. Aroma is malty, dried cherries, toffee, hints of cinnamon, toasted caramel, brown sugar, raisins, hints of sherry. Flavor is pretty sweet, light plus bitter, rich and malty with a light sherry note that is not really a detractor. Full body and creamy mouthfeel. Solid Old Ale.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Brown pour, no head. Aromas of raisin, dates, christmas cake, chocolate, toffee, walnut. Flavours of bonfire toffee, black treacle, chocolate cake, currants, raisin, some dark fruit. Exceedingly vinous (which is unsurprising). Long, warm sweet finish. Nice!

Bottle of 2010 Decadence. Pours a deep dark brown with a small off-white head that fades. Very sweet aroma, dates, figs, brown sugar, caramel, currants. Taste is rich and sweet, dates, currants, brown sugar, a hint of hobby bitterness and sharp booze on the finish. Lingering sweet booziness. Excellent and ages wonderfully.

Piana obfita, kremowa i drobna, barwa rubinowa, klarowna. Aromat nie jest bardzo intensywny, ale przyjemny, głównie słodkie ciasteczka, karmel, rodzynki, cukier kandyzowany, w tle niewielka ziołowość. W smaku dość słodkie - rodzynki, winogron, karmel, toffi, może miód... Zaskakuje niesamowicie gładka, aksamitna i oleista faktura, trunek wręcz pieści podniebienie... Niska, ziołowa goryczka, niskie wysycenie, pełne, wręcz tłuste w odbiorze, ładnie ukryty alkohol...

Bardzo brytyjska, klasyczna wersja Old Ale, dość nieskomplikowana, aczkolwiek wielkie brawa za fakturę piwa, za odczucie w ustach po każdym kolejnym łyku.

Ps.

Piwo ok półtora roku spędziło na leżaku.

bottle shared that poured a cola colored brown with no real head. nice sweet malty nose with some dried fruits and alcohol. flavor was truly olde ale style. really nice malt forward holding the dried dark fruits in the middle and finishing with that mild alcohol burn on the end. very tasty.

750 ml bottle. 2015 vintage. Thanks veliemboys! Pours a dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of strong sweet bread, some dried fruits and caramel. Flavour of heavy sweet bready malts, grassy bitterness, dried fruits, caramel and astrigent. Full bodied. Alcohol burns. Not my favourite.

75 cl bottle. 2015 vintage.
Pours clear dark red color with a small head. Aroma is quite resinous and piney, caramel malts and some grassy hops. Flavor is resinous hoppy, malty, caramel sweetness, honey, some oak notes, strong carbonation, molasses. Good but I was expecting more smoothness and maybe more layers.
4424

750ml bottle. Pours reddish brown with a smooth head. Aroma of ripe fruits, berries, earthy notes, caramel, toffee and hints of syrup. Taste is sweetish, caramely and malty with some berries, toffee, syrup and berries. Finish is caramely, earthy and sweetish with some malts, toffee, berries and hints of ripe fruits. Feels like a mix of a heavy amber ale and an English barley wine. Quite a heavy slow sipper.

From bottleshare. Dark brown, beige head. Caramel, dark fruits, toffee, fudge. 
Sweet stuff. Smooth fullbodied, a bit of boozyness.

Bottle from Chmiel. Aroma: Toffee, strong wine, light alcohol, dried fruit, caramel. Appearance: Dark amber colour, low head. Taste: Really soft malts, caramel, toffee, dried fruit, light boozy alcohol, light spicy hopiness. Palate: Sweet finish, high body, low carbonation.
Deep brown with small off-white head. Port, plums, toffee, honey, chewy malts.

Flaska från Galatea, privatimport. Provning med Nerikes Ölsällskap, tema amerikanska tungviktare, del II. Flaska från mars 2014. Elegant och varm röd/kopparfärgad med krämigt beiget skum. Söt doft med mycket övermogen frukt, men även lite syrliga toner från grönt äppelskal. Brunt socker, kola, lite inlagda bär. Stor, lite oljig kropp. Sött, tungt, lite lätt boozigt, malttungt, lite lätt rostade toner som bryter av, övermogen frukt, tung toffee.

This beer needs barrel aging. Brown color with tan head. Aroma is raisins, bread, caramel, and prune. Taste is just a lot of raisin with moderate sweetness for the high abv. Tough to drink a lot of but still decent.

Deep plummy copper hue under a thin light tan head. Rich lightly boozy dark malty English aroma with some date and fig in there. Smooth and dark flavor thats got that old English malty boozy touch to it, a light hint of date and fig, and a warm semisweet malty finish. A bit simplistic and has a lasting alcohol phenolic finish.

Aspetto: mogano scuro e limpido. Schiuma marroncina, abbondante, fine e abbastanza persistente. A Roma: intenso, chiari sentori liquorosi, caramellati e legnosi. Gusto: decisi sentori liquorosi e di Passito, abbondante e caramello, legnoso, abbondanti frutta secca e frutta a guscio. Corpo decisamente strutturato. Carbonizzazione medio bassa. Birra veramente fenomenale!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled: 02/27/14. Sampled: 02/28/16

Appearance: Dark, cloudy brown with amber highlights; thin beige head. There are huge chunks of yeast sediment at the end of the beer! The total amount is equivalent to what youd expect from Belgian ales.
Smell: Hella malts and even more dark fruits; doesnt change much after warming up.
Taste: Starts off with subtle, creamy malts before developing into a bold, sweet middle thats filled with dark fruits, caramel, toffee, & chocolates. The finish is reserved for a soft hoppy flavor thats prolonged with warm alcohol. Once warm, all the sweetness gets a bump and the alcohol certainly intensifies as well; it becomes very much like a sherry wine after some time in the glass.
Texture: Smooth, full-bodied, no carb, dry finish.
Drinkability: Delicious and absolutely wonder. This is a malt & sugar bomb. The alcohol is strong enough sustain some age. Oh, and share this with a friend!

Additional thoughts:
Overall tastes remind me of a doppelsticke (strong altbier) from Germany. So malty, sweet, & boozy with the benefits of age thrown in there. Also comparable to strong winter ales from Belgian breweries like Scaldis & Corsendonk.

opaque brown with ruby tones thin fragile crown of tan foam. Aroma of dark malts candy, soft brown sugar, dates, figs, prunes, caramel, chocolate, nuts (hazelnuts) and a faint touch of leather and tannic red wine. silky smooth flavor with hints of dark fruit, toffee, leather, soft coffee, snuff, brown sugar, nut and reminiscences of hops. Sensation in half and creamy mouth with sweet, dry, earthy and warm

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Pours opaque mahogany with a thin buff head. Aroma delivers caramel, toasted malt and woody hops tones. Flavor is a bit on the sweet side and offers caramel, toasted malt and woody hops notes. Mouthfeel features firm body and OK fizz. Get decadent!

Fruity with hints of berries in the aroma. Yeast, hard alcohol, and let fruity taste. Hard bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. But not so good. Severe beer. Too much alcohol taste. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
MMXV edition. Dark red-brown with small yellow head. Nice strong bread aroma. Quite strong bitterness rich with sweet bread notes. Bitter aftertaste.

2010 Decadence. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is dark fruit, plum and figs, caramel, pure sugar. Medium body, caramel, roast, dark fruit, hides alcohol well, very nice.

Sometimes you have to take things into consideration when rating, not with this beer, its worth its lofty status. Dark fruits, caramel, toffee, beautifully melded into a velvety body. This beer is thick and you can tell it is expertly crafted. Dont pass this by, buy 3 and hold 2 back for a few years. Excellent brew.
bottle. Dark brown with small white head. Malt and caramel aroma, dired fruits. Sweet caramel flavour, wooden, vanilla, hoppy finish. Fantastic

Aromat: głównie estrowy (wiśnia, aronia, śliwka), z dozą karmelu, chleba, melano, może nieco miodu. Drewno również wyczuwalne, ale bez przesady. Alkohol nieźle ukryty.

Wygląd: barwa rubinowa, wydaje się klarowna, Piana beżowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, umiarkowanej wielkości i podobnie trwała.

Smak: spora słodycz, złamana kwaskowoscią, owoce ( w tym suszone), chleb, melano, alkohol. Goryczka w okolicach średniej plus, lekko drażniąca, ale delikatna. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i kwaskowy, lekko owocowy finisz nuta alkoholową. Spodziewałem się więcej.
Refrigered 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Hazy Amber into a glass. Aroma is caramel malt, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt and wood.

05 Decadence. Pours brownish with a beige head. Small. N: dark english barleywine. So smooth, light roast, Heavy caramel and prunes. Great! T: so creamy and well.. Decadent.? Caramel and bruised fruit. Drinks perfect for a 10 year old beer. Aftertaste is semi drying but still heavy on the dark sweet fruits.
2005. Clear brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of prunes, raisins, caramel and sweets. A flavor of prunes, raisins, caramel and sweet malt.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Deep reddish mahogany, quite clear. Small tan head. Strong apple, fruit nose. Caramel, buttery notes. Quite a bit of bitterness, strong underlying sweetness. Very upfront alcohol content. Heavy, oily body. Really good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a dark brown color with red highlights and a large creamy-soapy orange-brown head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was sweet with raisins, plum, pear, brandy and molasses. The flavor was sweet with toasty malts, molasses, cherry, anise, raisin, fig, brandy, toffee and a touch of a medicinal presence. Long finish. Moderately full bodied. Excellent.

medium dark brown ruby with plenty of cream. Aroma raisins, currants, booze caramel ginger. Tastes of dark rum blackstrap molasses. Alesmiths super clean cut style makes this sorta boring to drink. not enough funky fruitness.

It pours a reddish brown with a light brown head that has plenty of carbonation. As it settles, it is fairly clear. It has sweet aromas highlight by fruit, caramel, molasses, nuts, and notes of sherry like qualities. It has flavors of caramel, chocolate, nuts, molasses, there are some fruity esters that are like dark fruits (plum like), and hints of sherry like qualities. As it warms, the sherry like qualities are more vinous. The nutty and chocoalte flavors become more prominent. It has a full body and is somewhat chewy with a quality alcohol warming.

Rating #1545 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday Brew Tour - On tap at Alesmith. Rich dark brown-black pour with a weak white head that bubbles away quickly, spotty lacing. Aroma is earthy - presence of peat smoke, toasted barley, chocolate, coffee grounds.Mouthfeel is clean, low carbonation, medium alcohol warmth. Taste is a depth of chocolately, nutty roast malts, ripe fleshy berry and currant balanced by a bready, sappy chewiness from the hop presence. Wicked brew.

Bottle (as Decadence 2010) at the main DC December gathering. Poured a brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma was lots of boozy notes. Whiskey, booze, dark fruits. Flavor was lots of toffee, caramel notes.
Nicely done. Old oxidized aroma and some caramel here. Some basement musk. Some sweetness in finish. Bottle shared at tasting.

Bottle at the DC December Gathering #2. As 2010 Decadence. Thanks MrChopin. Murky brown with beige head. Aromas of dark fruit, caramel, oak, some whiskey. Tastes of dark fruit, booze, some whiskey. Medium body with a dry finish.

750 ml bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is an ugly, murky brown color with a beige head foam. The aroma has a musty fruit quality to it that makes the toffee and molasses notes come through especially well. Medium sweetness with leathery notes in the taste. Medium, velvety carbonation. Big body. Nice.

Pours a deep, reddish-brown, with little by way of head. Aroma of fermented fruit and some booziness. Flavor is very sweet, a bit on the cloying side. Plum, currant, candy, a load of booze. Tastes better as it warms.

(bottle dated 03-04-14) Pours a deep amber color with a thin light tan to off-white head. Aroma consists of a melange of dried fruits with notable scents of dried apricot, cherry, prune, and dates. Along with the fruit is a prominent scent of peanut brittle. Some caramel and port as well.  Further warming yields some sour cream and red delicious apple. Flavor holds mulled wine, port, dates, toffee, sweet dark cherry, and jaggery. Mouthfeel is medium and carbonation is low.
Tasted at La Capsule (Nancy - France). Dark mahogany body, cloudy, with almost no foam. Aroma is nuts, dried fruit, caramel, roasted - heady. Taste is similar, with very strong alcohol; very round.
Bottle sample at SBWF15. Amberish brown with beige head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, burnt sugar, light chocolate and dried fruits. Taste is sweet and bitter, dried fruit, sugar, wood and alcohol. Nice.

Good shit. Sugary, sweet goodness. Malty. Kinda like a barley wine with a Scottish ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Barrels & Bottles. Dark brown appearance with a lacy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, toffee, nutty malts, light earthy hops, light coffee and a hint of alcohol. Similar flavor, thick, rich and malty with moderate sweetness, light bitterness and a touch of booze. Full body. A nice sipper overall.
750 ml bottle. This beer fucking blows camo can touch this shitty rocket fuel.

750 ml bottle dated 03/04/14. Pours a murky mahogany color with a thin khaki head that fades to a thin wispy film that leaves a crazy looking points at the collar. Aroma is sweet caramel brunt toffee some bakers chocolate and fruity after notes. Taste is bittersweet with fruitiness upfront then burnt caramel toffee flavors coming through as well as oak and alcohol. Palate is full sticky with a dry warming finish. Solid.

Medium beige head reddish dark brown pour medium carbonation aromas toasted malts syrup toffee brown sugar lots of caramelized notes rich alcohol citrus stone the flavours yeast toffee caramel brown sugar syrup dates raisins sultanas citrus cocoa chocolate caramelized touches everywhere bitter touch lovely sweetness balance the finish lovely stuff hops and lots of malts used wonderfully sugary tastes richness body a cracking Old Ale

Bottle @ Monterey Bar in Berlin


Appearance: Dark brown body, small beige head

Aroma: Sweet malt forward aroma, dark fruit

Taste: Caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dark berries, very light earthy hops 

Palate: Noticable alcohol as it warms, thicker than average body, would be really interesting to try a vertical with 1-2-3 year old bottles.

75 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, vanilla, dried fruit, and a little alcohol - with a slightly dry finish.

Bomber to a tulip. Thanks Kevin. Pours deep Amber brown with thin head and lacing. Notes of fresh baked brown bread, caramel and brown sugar. Flavors are complex layers or dark fruit, raisins, spice... Balanced with some mellow hop bitterness ... Delicious... Would like to revisit in after a few years in the cellar!

750ml bottle, from Dutchs. Totally hazy brown/red color. Thin off-white head, leaves good ridges and ropes of lace. Just a minimal ring halfway through though. Great dark fruit, earthy hop, nuttiness, mild vanilla. Bit of chocolate. Some decent roast malt. Moderate to bigger sweet, though not cloying. Good mild to moderate bitter, and nice bit of warmth on the finish. Bigger body. Very thick, kind of chewy mouthfeel, nice creamy fullness to the texture. Mild slick finish. Fantastic way to do an old ale. 11% alcohol works fabulously here.

750 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, beige head, over a clear copper/brown (SRM 19) body.......nose is heavy dried fruits including plum, raisin, fig all from the malts, light molasses, mild herbal notes, balance heavily to the malts......taste is sweet, with heavy dried fruits including fig, plum, raisin, molasses, hints of cocoa, finishing with light hop bitterness, balance to the malts......mouth feel, heavy sticky body, alcohol heat present, mild carbonation. This bottle is a bit too young, and probably needed another year or two as none of the usual signs of age (oxidation, sherry etc.) are present. The alcohol is high for the style, and too prominent, but aging would correct that. Alas, temptation led me astray. This is a nicely malt forward beer, which meets the style, but, my fault, I should have aged it for two or three years. BJCP 8/3/13/4/7

1pt 9.4 fl oz bottle from Brewdog online store. Dark brown amber colour, beige foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of malt, molasses, brown sugar, raisins, figs, booze. Taste is sweetish bready malt, brown sugar, molasses, dried fruits, christmas cake, boozy plus some grassy & spicy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, warming finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle, 75 cl. Dark brown body with no head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt. Similar taste, very rich. The alcohol adds some warmth. Light bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. This is a bit on the sweet side but the taste is so full. Great stuff.

August 22, 2015. Bottle at home, vintage 2015. 
Dark ruby red with a large creamy off-white head. Aroma is toffee, nuts, caramel, dried fruits, dark bread, some pine and earth notes. Taste is sweet, caramel and nutty, light bitter with a burnt caramel notes. Finish is sweet nutty, caramel and alcohol warmth. Medium bodied, average carbonation.
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 100ml sample. Noble and smooth aroma of dark fruit and well done toast. Quite a bit of alcohol, even when cold. Very nice.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber orange with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of sweet grains with a bit of caramel and toffee supporting. Flavor has lots of bread and toffee with a bit of caramel and a light grassy bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Intensywny aromat suszonych owoców. Rodzynki, figi, daktyle, czego tu nie ma ! Do tego sporo przyjemnie zaintonowanych nut utlenienia (nawet ździebło sosu sojowego), drewnianych, waniliowych, winnych, karmelowych i alkoholowych. Na samym wąchaniu można spędzić pół wieczoru ! 
W smaku bardzo pełne, wręcz wylepiające, słodkie, ale nie zmulające z cudownie owocową bazą, i bardzo przyjemnym grzejąco alkoholowym lekko cierpkim finiszem. Wysycenie niskie. Wspaniałe piwo degustacyjne.

18.07.2015, 0,75l bottle shared @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is very mild, raisins, dark malts, grass, almonds, dark sugar, weeds, minerals, burnt caramel. Taste is slightly dry grassy, weeds, raisins, grass, dark malts, dark sugar, booze, burnt caramel, oak. Medium bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle shared with BBGTC. Pours a hazy amer with a large fluffy light tanned head. Wonderful aroma of dates, raisins, caramelly malts and a light vinous note. Taste is sweet, huge caramel taste with dark dried fruits. Has a moderate bitter finish but lingers quite sweetly. Full bodied and avg to soft co2. Very fucking nice.

A very dark brown, a small head is dark beige. Aroma is rich with dark riped druits, dates and raisins, some port wine, toffee, drier wood and herbs, hint of vanilla. Very complex and succesfully aroma. Taste has rich and toffeeish maltyness, riped fruits and dates, balancing dry wood and herbs with bitterness, hint of vanilla. Full bodied, low carbonation, fresh anyway. Rich and complex, tasteful. The beer for slow enjoyment.
Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - fuzzy brown pour with beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste,toffee, caramel, plethora of dark dried fruits, nutty, some subtle spices, very nice.
Caramel, nutsbasement aromas, raisin aroma. Hazy, brown and cloudy appearance. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter and salty. Full body, oily feel, flat, long finish.

Aroma and taste is malts, caramel, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, toffee. Full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish. Excellent.

750 ml bottle, bottled on 02/26/14. Served in a snifter, the beer pours a murky reddish/brown color with about an inch beige head that stuck around a little while. Theres a decent amount of lacing. Aroma is nice and malty, the brew smells like toffee, dark fruit (plums, raisins), caramel, brown sugar, and some nuts. The taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also the addition of rum-like booziness, red grapes and currants. Mouthfeel/body is full, its creamy and coating with a moderate amount of carbonation. I thought this was pretty good, I think Ill have to pick up another bottle soon!

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy, deep amber with a small beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, Brown sugar and dried dark fruits. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, with a hint of bitterness and alcohol. Medium bodied, oily to syrupy texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Ale indeed.
Pours caramel with a medium tan head. Aromas of apple, caramel, honey and raisins. Taste is apple, honey, raisins, caramel and roasted nuts. Mouthfeel is medium bodied wiht medium carbonatioin.
750ml bottle pours out a amber ruby topped with a small sand head. Nose is sweet malts toffee caramel and some booze. Taste is more of the sweetness caramel toffee honey and some bitterness.
This is a party for your mouth. This could be a dessert all alone. Alesmith hit bullseye on this one.
Pours a ruby red with a slight brownish head. Aroma is redcurrants, caramel, toffee and malts. Taste is caramel, redcurrants, toffee and some bitter

Dark brown color with tan head score. plum raisin aroma. plum raisin alcohol 9 medium heavy. this is the cask

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

sample from bottle, as Olde Ale MMXIV. poured a poured a murky dark amber brown colour with a small beige head on top. notes of sweet caramel malts, butterscotch, raisins, caramel, walnuts, burned caramel, figs, plums, well balanced with the fruit flavor and sweetness, bit of vanilla, earth notes,wood, full bodied mouthfeel. sticky buttery, full flavoured beer. nice one again from alesmith! they never disappoint

Tap at the brewery. Pours hazy brown with a small, fizzy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is caramel and toast malt, alcohol, brown sugar, dates, and light earthy hops. Flavor is sweet malt, light cherry and nutmeg, alcohol, brown sugar and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Picked up a two year vertical at the brewery (skipped the package that included a glass). Have tried the 2015 bottle and on tap.

Excellent example of style. Malt backbone hides the alcohol well. This is a great strong ale. Notes of carmel and bread with very little hoppiness. Looking forward the the 2014 bottle (though I know I have tried it at the brewery a time or two last year).

Bottle from citybeer in SF about a year ago. Nice warm, sweet aroma of malt, brown sugar, cherry. Warm reddish brown with off white head. Has that characteristic Alesmith medicinal flavour Im not overly fond of. Nice smooth mouth feel.
May 1, 2015 - bottle from some place in Wisconsin. Brown pour witb big time head. Aroma was caramel, dark fruit and sugary sweetness. Taste was consistent with the aroma and some alcohol.
Bottle from BrewDog Shepherds Bush. Cloudy, orangey copper, smallish head. Fruity nose, followed by more raisins, plums and complex fruitiness in the mouth. Well-balanced and surprisingly drinkable.
750ml bomber from Sonoma Cellars, cellar aged 18 months and shared by all on poker night. Brownish pour. Little head. Interesting. Banana caramel in the flavor. Some earth. Most not a fan. 13.8

bottle with qc-crew, thanks guys! pours unclear light brown mahogany with a small light beige cap, minimal retention and lacing for its abv. dense toffee and berries, fruity multi-layered caramel, tons of raisins and dried fruit-plethora, very light smokiness/saltiness, lightyl earthy/woody. light to low carbonation, full body - thick; assertive grassy-spicy and warming finish. incredible malt depth/complexity. much enjoyed!

Low-medium carbonation level and just a hint of the big abv.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours mahogany with low beige head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of malt, molasses, porto, dark fruits, some metal. Taste is of malt, fruits, bitterness, caramel, some slight alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Overall: Nice malt features. Alcohol.

Bottle (2014). Bought @ Winooski Beverage Warehouse. Split 5-ways.

Appearance: Deep amber-brown with a medium easy to revive off-white head, little lacing and nice alcohol legs.

Aroma: Toffee, molasses, raisins, port notes, earthy/mineral presence, dried plums, figs and spices.

Taste: Moderately sweet. Rich malts, toffee, molasses, raisins, port, earthy/mineral notes, moderate spiciness, dried fruits and a bit of alcohol.

Draft at the brewery. Pours reddish but brown with a thick, fizzy beige head. Tastes like syrup, dried fruits, toasted malt, light booze. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dried fruits, cherry, booze, roasted malt.

Bread, caramel, fruit, nuts, and pipe tobacco in the aroma. Rich, smooth, sweet malty flavor with bread, caramel, toffee, and dark fruit. Some spice and drying alcohol in the finish. I like this style, and I love this beer.

Tap at BrewDog Nottingham. Aroma is fruity, alcohol, sweetness. Taste is fruity, alcohol. Good stuff

Dark reddish-brown pour with a brown head. Aroma is dark fruit, sweet. Taste is dark fruit, malty, a little leathery, a little dry. Love to age another to see how it weathers. Low carbonation. Tasty beer. OK lacing.
Hazrlnut colour, almost no head. Aroma of plums, figs, brown sugar, candy sugar. Taste is medium sweet, fruity flavour. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation.

06-FEB-2014, bottle @ulkløbben tasting, my place, from Kihoskh
Hazy amber with lasting tan head.
Aroma is caramel, bread, nuts, chocolate.
Taste the same. Very nice malty drink with just a touch of bitterness.

July 10th, 2013 - I had the pleasure of enjoying this beauty at the brewery itself - a dark, sweet sultry beer which is RIGHT inside of Alesmiths bailiwick. I trust these guys to do dark beers well, and they follow through with their Old Ale. Im covering both versions in this review: a draft and a cask. Both smelled similarly, with a dark, clove riddled scent. The flavor on the draft version is chocolatey, malty, boozey and coated in molasses - like when sugar on a rich, dark chocolate bar begins to crystallize. Its the pure essence of dark and sweet. The cask smells much like the draft, but the flavor is remarkably different. Here the palate is obviously flatter, and strikes out on a less sweet and sugary path, tasting more of teriyaki and tempura sauces with a savory quality that complements the sweet. Both are excellent beers, and excellent contributions to the tap list.

Tap at BrewDog Manchester. As Olde Ale. Near black with a tan head. Aroma reveals itself slowly but is fairly complex. Toffee, nuts, coffee and praline show up at one time or another. Taste is lightly toasted caramelised sugars with a hint of fruit; nice but not as seductive as the aroma. Not nearly as thick and cloying as I expected. Good showing, but fell a bit short of my expectations.

Keg at brewdog bar, manc. Clear burgundy with a small halo head. Aroma is rich malt, bread, some rummy sherry notes. Taste is alcohol spice and sweet and bitter. Full bodied with nice restrained carbonation. Excellent.
Bomber. Hazy garnet with a beige head. Sweet vanilla, cherry and toffee. Tart, bread pudding and dry.
Labeled as Olde Ale. Unclear brownish body with a medium offwhite head. Aroma is dark fruits, bourbon notes, caramel, malt. Flavour is light alcohol, dark fruits, caramel, nuts. Wow this is good.

W aromacie arcyprzyjemne wiśnie w czekoladzie, do tego karmel, ciasto murzynek, lekko likierowa nuta alkoholowa, w duchu szkockich wee heavy.

Labelled as "olde ale". Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma of dark sweet malts, caramel, dates, figs, prunes, toffee, chocolate, nuts (hazelnuts) and a weak hint of fresh leather. The taste has some weak roast, toffee, weak nutty feel, some bitter hops, dark dried fruits, chocolate, a hint of leather and some dark sweet malts. Really nice old ale indeed!

Bottle as "Olde Ale". Pours cloudy dark brown with a small fizzy offwhite head. Aromas of caramel, malt, some licorice, dates, hazelnut, chocolate. Taste is pretty malty up front, slight licorice, hazelnut, dates, caramel, slight alcohol, some banana-like sweetness.
Bottle @ Vinoble Odense. Pours dark ruby amber with a creamy head. Rich and vinous. Dark dried fruit, licorice, chocolate and caramel. Smooth and vinous. Quite soft! Delicious!

1/3 of a pint at Newcastle Brewdog. Complex aromas of Liquorice, seaweed and mop bucket. Pitch black with a tan skim. Liquorice Imp, soy sauce, cough candy. Slightly sticky mouthfeel, full bodied. Looong finish. A Christmas treat, loved every sip.

75cl bottle from the Bottle Shop, Bermondsey London. As Alesmith Olde Ale. It pours a dark brown color with a nice beige head. Aroma is sweet and malty, with notes of toffe, licorice and herbs. Taste is quite sweet, with notes of candy sugar, licorice, bread, light booze. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, tasty and sweet

(Bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 15 2014 as Olde Ale MMXIV) Pours bright red brown, small whitish ring of head. Aroma is like English barley wine lite. Toffee, caramel, brown sugar, dried fruits (apricot, berries, prune), partly raisinated brandy grape notes. Flavour follows nose, with the initial malt and fruit sweetness fading into a nice brandy type middle with grape and spirit notes, a bit of an earthy, softly woody character, and then finally dried by alcohol to make a smooth finish with no real hop bitterness or residual alcohol heat. Medium full body, moderate carb. Very elegant old ale, nice fruity cognac-ish quality with no spirit harshness, though lacking the concentrated flavours of an excellent barley wine. Still really easy to drink and decently complex.

Shared 750 ml. bottle as Olde Ale MMXIV, poured to snifters showing a cloudy, brown color, with a modest layer of tan head foam, and waves & spots of lacing. The nose offered some toast, toffee, caramel, and brown sugar sweetness, with esters as dried fruit, and alcohol at the ready. The taste was similar notes, plus moderate, earthy bitterness, somewhat of a syrupy texture, full body, moderate carbonation, and alcohol that was boozy, but also quite warming. Tastiest sampling of the evening!

Tasty malt profile but not a huge fan of the apple/pear esters.

2010 bottle. Pours a deep ruby with a ring of a head and slight sediment. Aroma is a big sweet caramel with dark fruits, dark cherries, sugar, and almost barrel charistics. Very pleased with this one. Solid malt flavor. A bit of alcohol heat, but very smooth considering the incredibly high ABV.

Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.

Bottle shared at BBF14. Pours hazy medium brown with a decent beige head. Aroma of plums, dates and lots of malt and some caramel. Sweet body with quite some alcohol, taste is caramel and bready malts.

Alesmith Olde Ale, bottled March 4, 2014. 
Pours chestnut brown with a garnet hue when held in the light. Little head retention, which is expected for this style and such a high abv. Aroma of raisins, currants, port (vinous), apricots, nuts, sweet malt, and lots of booze. The flavor comes on in many layers, it starts off bright and fruity with a candy sweetness, then the alcohol burn kicks in, followed by hop bitterness at the end. In theory this should be a well balanced beer, but it seems that the flavors come on in waves and are not harmonious. I do like this beer overall, as I love big beers, so kudos to them for even making it and offering it up to us beer geeks!

Figs and cherries linger long after the finish. No hops at all, no bitterness. Very nice Old Ale.
Brilliant amber in color... Aroma of stone fruits, Caramel malts... Flavor is peated malts, smoke, spices, malts... Really rich, pleasant... Amazing.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is oxidized caramel, wine wood, fruits, more caramel. Flavour is thick molasses caramel, liqourice, oak etc etc. Great but too sweet to really enjoy for my taste.

On draft at he brewery. Pours a cloudy brown with a beige head. Nutty malt nose. Flavors of caramel with dark fruit notes. Medium heavy body. Slight bitter and roasty finish. Alesmith Olde Ale British-Style Ale MMXIV 750 ml bottle, bottled on 2/26/14. Pours dark ruby amber with a medium creamy off-white head that goes to a thin film and leaves a little lacing.

Bottle at home. Pours deep amber with a creamy mocca colored head. The aroma is loads of toasted malt, dark sugars, ripe fruit and chocolate caramel. Huge toasted malty flavor. Biscuits, crackers and ripe fruit. Awesome!

A perfect beer to split 3 or 4 ways with quiet company. Toffee, prune, raisin, molasses. Could pack a bit more oomph for the ABV, but a lovely winter sipper.

Darkest of brown with yellowish-tan head. Nose is ripe with carmelized sugars, toffee, dark fruit, and peppery alcohol. Flavor is toffee, prune, raisin, molasses, carmelized sugars, and booze. Liquid very rich fruitcake. Enjoyed this. Lovely Old Ale!

Draft at GBBF 2013, Day 3 - London. Pours clear amber with a light, tan cream head. The aroma is all dried fruits and rich malts. Medium to big sweet flavor with more dried fruits, golden raisins, brown sugar. Full bodied with soft carbonation and oily mouthfeel. Sweet finish with light dryness, oily and aged fruits. Very tasty beer.

Finally got around to opening a bottle of this of New Years Eve. Dark mahogany with a tan head. Blend of caramel malts, brown sugar, figs, toffee and some pit fruit. Mild carbonation and moderate body, sweet and boozy, long finish and delicious.

Bottle as Old Ale 2013. Poured slightly hazy dark amber with a small white head. Aroma of alcohol soaked dark fruit, toasted malt, light spice. Full body, flavour is quite alcoholically sweet, loads of berries and plum in there.

Pours a dark dirty mahogany color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is plum, figs, brown sugar, light alcohol, and toffee malts. Taste is much the same. Solid Old Ale but I would prefer some age on this baby....

Bottle @ Deans Winter Shelter Tasting, courtesy of Vaiz, labeled as Old Ale. Pours a hazy brown beer with a thin, beige head on top. Aroma is mostly alcoholic spices, dark fruits and some old yeasts. Flavor is quite sweet and herbal, alcohol is present, some chocolate notes and very spicey overall. Very nice old ale, great representation of the style! Nice!

Bottle shared @ THT.
Hazy deep brown pour. Thin tan head. Malty aroma. Well hidden alcohol.

Bottle at Deans Winter Shelter Tasting. Poured a clear dark amber with a thin white head. The aroma is weak yeast malt. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a rich liqourice aniseed alcohol bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle shared at Deans Winter Shelter Tasting. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, overripe dark fruits. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled from bottle @ Deans Winter Shelter Tasting. Clear red color, small beige head. Smell and taste malts, lightly alcohol, slightly sweet, also some bitter, lightly some dark fruits. Full body, medium carbonation.

Bottle at Deans Winter Shelter Tasting @ ABCBeers. Hazy brown pour. Aroma of brown sugars, creamy malts, some caramel and a hint of licorice. Flavor is slightly sweet, slightly bitter, well balanced and with a huge body. Subtle and very smooth.

Pours a beautify deep ruby reddish light brown. Medium to large Thick frothy creamy sticky khaki head, fairly lasting with good lace. Very complex, malty smooth sweet aroma. Great balance. Just a fantastic beer.

very sweet, malty, dark fruit, spice. 
Taste is very similar. Strong, sweet, malty, complex.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 2013 Old Ale,750mL bottle shared with kegbear, deep tannish orange pour with a frothy head. Decent aroma of bread crust and malt. Tastes of sweet caramel malt, a bit of resiny booze in the finish. Wow what a good beer!!

text: Brown pour with a white head. The aroma is full of toffee and caramel with some brown sugar mixed in. The flavor has a good bit of leather and tobacco with some cherries, toffee, caramel and brown sugar. The alcohol is also noticeable. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

bottled as 2013 Old Ale. pours ruby tan with a large tan head that leaves a slick lacing coat. nose of raisins, cherry, caramel, booze. taste has all of the elements wrapped in a thick body that has undulating sweetness. light booze burn is enjoyable.
Bottle thanks to Caramel, spice, cherries, bold, dark fruits...Taste is spice, caramel, dark chocolate covered cherries, light sweetness, Graham cracker

Bottle. Deep brown liquid with small to medium light brown head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, bread, biscuit, raw sugar, dried fruit, pine and earth. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of toffee, bread, dried fruit and raw sugar. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice.

750 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of toffee, sherry, earthiness, prune, raisin and light carmel. Palate was medium to full bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, earthiness,sherry, prune and carmel with a smooth lingering fruity toffee finish.

As AleSmith Old Ale

.75 bottle. Dark brown, clear. Good yeasty esters, raisin, plum maltyness. Good candyness.-- bb/wp8

Mahogany/brown with a one-finger tan head and very nice lace. Aromas of caramel malt, brown sugar, fig, grapefruit and alcohol. Sweetness from brown sugar and caramel up front, followed quickly with a grapefruit bite with toffee, port, and hints of alcohol. Medium body, minimal carbonation, sticky mouthfeel and a lingering sweetness.

Cask at The Great British Beer Festival 2013.
Poured a very dark ruby with a dense, creamy tan head. Strong aroma of prunes, burnt sugar and some vanilla essence. Sweet toffee, dark malts and alcohol soaked dried fruit flavours. Thick, velvety mouth feel. Palate of a little coffee, maple syrup and dark rum. Damn good.

Bottle at the house. Aroma is prune and fig, some molasses, light caramel. Pours dark brown, pretty much black. Soft palate with tons of fig and date flavors as well as caramel and raisin. Good stuff.
Cask at gbbf 2013. Ruby red copper colour with a persistent thick cream head. Nose is nutty solvent warming. Flavour is intense oak toffee caramel and raisin. Silky palate. Warming alcohols.
Pours brownish cooper with off white hear and nice lacing. Aroma of cherry liquor, caramel malts, and booze. The taste is dark fruit, toffee malts, and cough syrup. Very booze, but good.
Thanks for the share OmegaX. This brew was full of toffee-malt goodness. As it warmed up it got bitter-sweet with a delectable finish of caramel and dank hops. Seriously good stuff here.

2013-09-01. Dark brown body with a nice foamy head. 4+ Aroma of sugary malt, interesting malt accents and undertones, tiny hints Of herbal licorice character. Flavour is sweet, sugary malt character, interesting malty accents. Modest alcohol throughout. 7+ Very smooth medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. Nice, I want to love it but there is something about the overall impression that I dont care for. Bottle labelled as Alesmith Old Ale from San Diego shared by a friend.

Gravity dispense at GBBF 13, as Alesmith Old Ale, 15/08/13.
Hazed dark chestnut brown with a thin light tan head.
Nose is toffee fudge, dark malts, sugars, vanilla, woody notes, dark fruit, raisens.
Taste comprises light cocoa, toffee fudge, dark toffee, prunes, dates, muscavado sugars.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, light booze in the finish.
Good stuff.

text: Bottle from Larry, 2013 bottle. Pours a dark brown tea like color with a nice creamy white head. Aroma of malt, nuttiness and some dark fruit. Taste is a little boozy up front and quite a bit of dark fruits in the finish, with a nice creamy malt finish.

750 ml. bottle that says Old Ale It pours a handsome dark purplish red with a tan head. The aroma is filled with lots of red ripe fruit, brown sugar and a hint of molasses. Cherry candy and Fig Newtons. The flavor is ultra rich and rather syrupy with sweet figs and surprisingly strong earthy bitterness. Pretty noticeable alcohol too. I see this maturing well. A bit young right now.

(Tap, GBBF 2013): Sold as Old Ale - Almost black in colour, no head. Roasted malt, coffee, bitter dark chocolate on the nose. Very rich flavours of heavily roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel and dark fruits. Theres a fairly big presence of alcohol but doesnt deter from the fantastic mix of flavours.

Massive english malt aroma. Dark brown appearance with a thin foam. Rich flavors of toffee, coffee beans, smoked black malts, english malt and cocoa beans. Overall, very unique english ale with dark malts. Id give this a B+ rating.
Cask (labelled Old Ale) at GBBF 2013, Olympia, London. A deep brown coloured pour with a small beige head on top. Sweet, caramel aroma. Tastes sweet, caramel, dark fruit, rich.
Tap at GBBF as Alesmith Old Ale. Big caramel and fruit nose, mostly dried fruits, raisin. Rich, fruity flavor, dreid fruits, hot alcohol, fun, fruity, rich as hell.

15 aug 2013, bottle. Brown, clear. Nose is meaty, mild alcohol, oatmeal. Med body and faintly fizzy. Sugary, brown sugar oatmeal, a bit meaty. I likes.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with amber tint around the edges and a 1 finger white head. Aroma is dark fruit and some chocolate. Taste is cherries, chocolate, caramel malt and booze. Palate is very rich and smooth. This is huge and awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

GBBF sold as Alesmith Old Ale. Clear brown to red with a little head. Smell - what I would describe as a classic old ale smell (a smell that I use to describe other beers but that cant really be described itself), a little alcohol. Body is quite syrupy, medium, very low carbonation. Taste - alcohol is quite prominent, mild, malty, I think that I can pick up a bit of banana, red fruits, slight sherry...Not bad.
On tap at Gbbf 2013. Quite choccy sweet. Some toffee. Quite drinkable sweet sherry like. Good.

Draught as "Old Ale" @ AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego, CA
Pours hazy reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, licorice, alcohol and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, licorice and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap as Old Ale 2013 at the taproom. Pours brown with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, some nuts, dried fruits and red apple peel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, warming alcohol, nuts and raisins. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at the taproom. As Old Ale. Dark reddish brown body under a small light beige head. Theres some lacings. Dried fruits, roasted malts, alcohol, dark chocolate and a hint of hops in the aroma. Sweet flavor with lots of dried fruits, some roasted malts and dark chocolate. Alcohol warmth in the mouth, full body, and a very pleasant carbonation. Long finish. Most definitely a nice one. Loads of nice flavors packed in one brew. 130814
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Very good old ale on tap at brewery thanks GT2. Toffee pour, off white head, nose is sweet, taste is caramel, boozy and awesome.

Pours clear dark brown with low tan head. Aroma of cherry, port wood, muscovado, dates and figs. Taste is cherry bitter and port sweet. Lingering port finish. Full, sticky body with soft carbonation
